analyzed: bden bral gyi ma rur yi ge ma las skyes pa'i ro yin la /
translated: In the land of Maru of Nairṛtī, the syllable ma is generated from the syllable ma.

original: nang du ni bden bral gyi rtsa'i srog 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: nang du ni bden bral gyi rtsa'i srog 'gog pa ste /
translated: Internally, the life of the Nairṛtī nāḍī is blocked.

original: rkang pa'i mthe bong gnyis la ma dgod pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthe bong gnyis la ma dgod pa'o //
translated: The syllable ma is placed on the two big toes.

original: me'i mtshams kyi ku lu t'ar yi ge ku las skyes pa'i ro yin la /
analyzed: me'i mtshams kyi ku lu t'ar yi ge ku las skyes pa'i ro yin la /
translated: In the land of Kuluta of Agni, the syllable ku is generated from the syllable ku.

original: nang du ni me'i mtshams kyi rtsa'i srog 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: nang du ni me'i mtshams kyi rtsa'i srog 'gog pa ste /
translated: Internally, the life-force of the channel at the boundary of fire is blocked.🔽The syllable ku is placed on the two knees.

original: pus mo gnyis la yi ge ku dgod pa'o zhes ni sku'i 'khor lo dang / bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i dur khrod dang / nye ba'i dur khrod kyi gdan gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: pus mo gnyis la yi ge ku dgod pa'o zhes ni sku'i 'khor lo dang / bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i dur khrod dang / nye ba'i dur khrod kyi gdan gyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the seat of the charnel grounds and the adjacent charnel grounds of the body cakra and the great-bliss cakra.

original: ro'i gdan rdzogs par byed pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge 'di rnams kun ni rnal 'byor pas rtsa'i @175b gdan gyi nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor rnams 'byung bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ro'i gdan rdzogs par byed pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge 'di rnams kun ni rnal 'byor pas rtsa'i @175b gdan gyi nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor rnams 'byung bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: All of these seed syllables that complete the seat of corpses should be visualized by the yogī as the arising of the maṇḍala of suns of the channel seats.

original: de nas au ma dang dbang phyug chen po'i steng du cha'i zla bas sgra gcan nyi ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor spros pa'o //
analyzed: de nas au ma dang dbang phyug chen po'i steng du cha'i zla bas sgra gcan nyi ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor spros pa'o //
translated: Then, above Umā and Maheśvara, Rāhu emanates the maṇḍalas of the sun and moon from the water moon.

original: der ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs kyi ro'i steng du nyi ma'i gdan bzhi'o //
analyzed: der ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs kyi ro'i steng du nyi ma'i gdan bzhi'o //
translated: There, on the seat of corpses in the directions of the gnosis cakra, there are four seats of suns.

original: dur khrod kyi phyogs mtshams la nyi ma'i gdan brgyad do //
analyzed: dur khrod kyi phyogs mtshams la nyi ma'i gdan brgyad do //
translated: In the cardinal and intermediate directions of the charnel grounds, there are eight seats of suns.

original: thugs dang gsung dang sku'i 'khor lo'i phyogs dang / mtshams kyi ro rnams kyi steng du zla ba'i gdan nyi shu rtsa bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: thugs dang gsung dang sku'i 'khor lo'i phyogs dang / mtshams kyi ro rnams kyi steng du zla ba'i gdan nyi shu rtsa bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on twenty-four moon seats above the tastes in the directions and intermediate directions of the wheels of body, speech, and mind.

original: de nas nam mkha' las thig le dang / n'a da bkug nas snying po ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i padma'i lte ba'i steng du ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid yi ge h'um gi sa bon gyi tshogs spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nam mkha' las thig le dang / n'a da bkug nas snying po ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i padma'i lte ba'i steng du ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid yi ge h'um gi sa bon gyi tshogs spro bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having drawn in the drops and nādas from space, one should emanate the collection of seed syllables of the essence, the nature of the five awarenesses, above the center of the lotus of the gnosis wheel in the heart.

original: ye shes kyi padma'i shar la sogs pa'i phyogs la k'a k'a kam ka: dur khrod kyi phyogs la yon tan gyi dbye bas ni /
analyzed: ye shes kyi padma'i shar la sogs pa'i phyogs la k'a k'a kam ka: dur khrod kyi phyogs la yon tan gyi dbye bas ni /
translated: In the east, etc., of the gnosis lotus, one should place the syllables ka kha ga gha ṅa, and in the eight charnel grounds, by the division of the qualities,🔽ka kha ga gha ṅa.🔽In the intermediate directions, one should place the syllables ca cha ja jha ña,

original: ka k'a kam ka: bya ba'o //
analyzed: ka k'a kam ka: bya ba'o //
translated: ṭa ṭha ḍa ḍha ṇa,🔽ta tha da dha na,🔽pa pha ba bha ma,🔽ya ra la va,

original: mtshams rnams la ha h'a ham ha: zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams rnams la ha h'a ham ha: zhes bya'o //
translated: śa ṣa sa ha kṣa.

original: stong pa'i chos las bzhengs nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang / dur khrod brgyad ni bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa'i chos las bzhengs nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang / dur khrod brgyad ni bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Having arisen from the empty phenomena, the gnosis wheel and the eight charnel grounds become the nature of twelve.

original: thugs kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs rnams la /
analyzed: thugs kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs rnams la /
translated: In the directions of the mind wheel,

original: ke ke ko ke zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ke ke ko ke zhes bya'o //
translated: one should place the syllables ke khe ko ho.

original: mtshams rnams la ki kri ku kli zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams rnams la ki kri ku kli zhes bya'o //
translated: The intermediate directions are called kī kī kṛ kṛ.

original: gsung gi 'khor lo'i phyogs rnams la yon tan gyi dbye bas ke kar ko kal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsung gi 'khor lo'i phyogs rnams la yon tan gyi dbye bas ke kar ko kal zhes bya'o //
translated: The directions of the wheel of speech are called ka ka ka ka by the division of the qualities.

original: mtshams rnams la ke k'ar ko k'a la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams rnams la ke k'ar ko k'a la zhes bya'o //
translated: The intermediate directions are called ka ka ka ka.

original: sku'i 'khor lo'i phyogs rnams la yan aa 'di shas ni kya kra kla kva zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sku'i 'khor lo'i phyogs rnams la yan aa 'di shas ni kya kra kla kva zhes bya'o //
translated: The directions of the wheel of body are called khya khya khya khya, kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa, ga ga ga ga, and gha gha gha gha.

original: rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i chos kyis bzhengs nas snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin 'khor lo gsum gyi gsal byed ni ;
analyzed: rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i chos kyis bzhengs nas snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin 'khor lo gsum gyi gsal byed ni ;
translated: Having arisen by the qualities of wind, fire, water, and earth, the consonants of the three wheels are of the nature of great compassion.

original: nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: They become the nature of twenty-four.

original: yang na rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa drug gi rang gi ming gi yi ges bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa drug gi rang gi ming gi yi ges bskyed pa'o //
translated: Or they are generated by the syllables of the names of the thirty-six yoginīs.

original: de nas yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa /
analyzed: de nas yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa /
translated: Then the five-tined vajra, which is the transformation of the syllable hūṃ,

original: yi ge h'um mgon po dang bcas pa rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin 'od zer gyi tshogs spros pas ma lus pa'i nam mkha'i khams rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge h'um mgon po dang bcas pa rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin 'od zer gyi tshogs spros pas ma lus pa'i nam mkha'i khams rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The syllable hūṃ together with the Lord emanates a mass of light rays, the nature of Vajrasattva, filling the entire realm of space.

original: de'i 'od zer rnams kyis rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i sems can gyi khams bkug nas de la zhugs par byas te /🔽yongs su gyur nas bdag nyid ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang ldan pa bcom ldan 'das he ru ka kha dog @176a * //
analyzed: de'i 'od zer rnams kyis rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i sems can gyi khams bkug nas de la zhugs par byas te / yongs su gyur nas bdag nyid ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang ldan pa bcom ldan 'das he ru ka kha dog @176a * //
translated: Those light rays summon the realms of sentient beings, perfect and imperfect, and cause them to enter into that.

original: sngon po zhal bzhi pa spyan gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po zhal bzhi pa spyan gsum pa'o //
translated: Having transformed, one is the Bhagavān Heruka together with the maṇḍala wheel, blue, with four faces and three eyes.

original: phyag bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: phyag bcu gnyis pa /
translated: He has twelve arms,

original: drag po dang dkar mo'i steng du g-yas brkyang bar bzhugs pa dbu skra ser skya steng du 'bar ba /
analyzed: drag po dang dkar mo'i steng du g-yas brkyang bar bzhugs pa dbu skra ser skya steng du 'bar ba /
translated: standing with the right leg straight on top of Rudra and white Umā, with tawny hair blazing upward.

original: phyag rgya lngas sku rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya lngas sku rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: His body is fully ornamented with the five symbolic ornaments.

original: thod pa'i phreng ba'i dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: thod pa'i phreng ba'i dbu rgyan can /
translated: He has a head ornament of a garland of skulls.

original: sku la thal bas byugs pa /🔽mgo bo'i phreng bas mdzes pa /
analyzed: sku la thal bas byugs pa / mgo bo'i phreng bas mdzes pa /
translated: His body is smeared with ashes.🔽He is beautified by a garland of heads.

original: sprul gyi tshangs skud dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sprul gyi tshangs skud dang ldan pa /
translated: He has a sacred thread of snakes.

original: rdo rje phag mos sku la 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mos sku la 'khyud pa'o //
translated: Vajravārāhī embraces him.

original: 'khyud pa'i phyag gnyis kyi rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgyas rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa /
analyzed: 'khyud pa'i phyag gnyis kyi rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgyas rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa /
translated: With the two embracing hands in the gesture of victory, he holds a vajra and a vajra-bell.

original: phyag gnyis kyis glang po che'i pags pa rlon pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag gnyis kyis glang po che'i pags pa rlon pa 'dzin pa /
translated: With two hands he holds a fresh elephant skin.

original: g-yas pa'i phyag rnams la da ma ru dang / dgra sta dang / gri gug dang / rtse gsum 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i phyag rnams la da ma ru dang / dgra sta dang / gri gug dang / rtse gsum 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the right hands he holds a ḍamaru, a battle-ax, a flaying knife, and a trident.

original: g-yon pa rnams kha tv'am ga dang / thod pa dang rdo rje zhags pa dang / tshangs pa'i mgo bo 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa rnams kha tv'am ga dang / thod pa dang rdo rje zhags pa dang / tshangs pa'i mgo bo 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the left hands he holds a khaṭvāṅga, a skull, a vajra-lasso, and a head of Brahmā.

original: rtsa ba'i zhal ni nag po'o //🔽g-yas pa ni padma r'a ga dang 'dra ba'o //🔽nub tu ni gser zhun ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i zhal ni nag po'o // g-yas pa ni padma r'a ga dang 'dra ba'o // nub tu ni gser zhun ma lta bu'o //
translated: The principal face is black.🔽The right face is like a ruby.🔽The western face is like molten gold.

original: g-yon pa ni kha ba dang / kunda dang zla ba dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa ni kha ba dang / kunda dang zla ba dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The left face is like snow, jasmine, or the moon.

original: shin tu 'jigs pa'i zhal gyi mche ba gtsigs pa /
analyzed: shin tu 'jigs pa'i zhal gyi mche ba gtsigs pa /
translated: The extremely terrifying face bares its fangs.

original: spyi bo zla ba phyed dang ldan pa sna tshogs rdo rjes cod pan mnan pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: spyi bo zla ba phyed dang ldan pa sna tshogs rdo rjes cod pan mnan pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: The head is adorned with a half-moon and a crossed vajra.

original: rdo rje phag mo ni kha dog dmar po'am /
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo ni kha dog dmar po'am /
translated: Vajravārāhī is red in color,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi kha dog dang mtshungs pa phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi kha dog dang mtshungs pa phyag gnyis pa /
translated: or the same color as the Bhagavān, with two arms,

original: zhal gcig pa gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: zhal gcig pa gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa /
translated: one face, holding a flaying knife and skull cup,

original: zhal gdangs pa /
analyzed: zhal gdangs pa /
translated: with a gaping mouth,

original: zhal gyi mche ba gtsigs pa dang / phyag rgya lnga yis rnam par brgyan //🔽sgeg pa'i ro dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: zhal gyi mche ba gtsigs pa dang / phyag rgya lnga yis rnam par brgyan // sgeg pa'i ro dang yang dag ldan //
translated: with bared fangs, and adorned with the five symbolic ornaments,🔽endowed with the taste of passion,

original: khrag gi ro yis brgyal nyid do //
analyzed: khrag gi ro yis brgyal nyid do //
translated: and fainting from the taste of blood.

original: de ltar bdag nyid ni ye shes kyi padma'i lte ba la gdan thams cad kyis rdzogs pa yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin rnal 'byor pas blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid ni ye shes kyi padma'i lte ba la gdan thams cad kyis rdzogs pa yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin rnal 'byor pas blta bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, the yogin should visualize himself as the essence of perfect meditative concentration, complete with all the seats in the center of the lotus of gnosis.

original: nang du na lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: nang du na lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: Internally, it is the innate joy.

original: rdo rje phag mo ni de'i 'od zer gyi 'od thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ste /
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo ni de'i 'od zer gyi 'od thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ste /
translated: Vajravārāhī is the light of that light, the omniscience,

original: zla ba'i mtshan ma dang 'dra bar dbyer med pa'i chos can ma'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i mtshan ma dang 'dra bar dbyer med pa'i chos can ma'o //
translated: the indivisible reality, similar to the moon-sign.

original: lte ba dang gsang ba dang rdo rje nor bur sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi chos kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ni bcom ldan 'das he ru kar brjod do //
analyzed: lte ba dang gsang ba dang rdo rje nor bur sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi chos kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ni bcom ldan 'das he ru kar brjod do //
translated: At the navel, the secret part, and the vajra gem, the innate joy of the body, speech, and mind is the Bhagavān Heruka.

original: 'dir lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ni ye shes kyi zhal bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ni ye shes kyi zhal bzhi pa'o //
translated: Here, the innate joy is the four faces of gnosis.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das @176b zhal bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das @176b zhal bzhi pa ste /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān has four faces.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs dang / ye shes kyi zhal gyi bdag nyid zhal bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs dang / ye shes kyi zhal gyi bdag nyid zhal bzhi pa'o //
translated: He has four faces, the nature of the body, speech, mind, and gnosis.

original: zhal bzhi po de rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis byang dang lho dang / shar dang gzhan ni 'khor lo'i rtsibs la mkha' 'gro ma sum cu rtsa drug yang dag par gnas so //
analyzed: zhal bzhi po de rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis byang dang lho dang / shar dang gzhan ni 'khor lo'i rtsibs la mkha' 'gro ma sum cu rtsa drug yang dag par gnas so //
translated: On the four faces, the thirty-six dakinis are perfectly situated on the spokes of the wheel, naturally in the north, south, east, and the other.

original: phyi rol gyi ri rab kyi steng sna tshogs padma'i lte ba la rigs ldan ma rdo rje phag mo ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ri rab kyi steng sna tshogs padma'i lte ba la rigs ldan ma rdo rje phag mo ste /
translated: On the outer Meru, in the center of a variegated lotus, is the Vajravarahi of the Tathagata family.

original: nang du ni gsang ba'i padma'i rtsa ba'i gdan la'o //
analyzed: nang du ni gsang ba'i padma'i rtsa ba'i gdan la'o //
translated: Inwardly, she is on the seat of the root of the secret lotus.

original: phyi rol du lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rang bzhin ma ni padma'i shar gyi 'dab ma la kha dog sngon po rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ste /
analyzed: phyi rol du lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rang bzhin ma ni padma'i shar gyi 'dab ma la kha dog sngon po rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ste /
translated: Externally, the nature of the mindfulness of body is the blue Vajra dakini on the eastern petal of the lotus, blue in color.

original: nang du ni snying ga'i padma'i bdag gi gdan la'o //
analyzed: nang du ni snying ga'i padma'i bdag gi gdan la'o //
translated: Internally, she is on one's own seat in the lotus of the heart.

original: lho'i 'dab ma la tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rang bzhin ma ni kha dog dmar po l'a ma ste /
analyzed: lho'i 'dab ma la tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rang bzhin ma ni kha dog dmar po l'a ma ste /
translated: The nature of the mindfulness of feeling is the red dakini on the southern petal, red in color.

original: nang du ni mgrin pa'i padma'i gzhan gyi gdan la'o //
analyzed: nang du ni mgrin pa'i padma'i gzhan gyi gdan la'o //
translated: Internally, she is on the seat of another in the lotus of the throat.

original: nub kyi 'dab ma la sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rang bzhin ma ni rgyu mthun la sogs gser zhu ba dang 'dra ba dum skyes ma ste /
analyzed: nub kyi 'dab ma la sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rang bzhin ma ni rgyu mthun la sogs gser zhu ba dang 'dra ba dum skyes ma ste /
translated: The nature of the mindfulness of mind is the dakini Khaṇḍarohā, who is like the fluidity of melted gold, on the western petal.

original: nang du lte ba'i padma'i sngags kyi gdan la'o //
analyzed: nang du lte ba'i padma'i sngags kyi gdan la'o //
translated: Internally, she is on the seat of mantra in the lotus of the navel.

original: byang gi 'dab ma la chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rang bzhin ma ni kha dog dkar po gzugs can ma ste /
analyzed: byang gi 'dab ma la chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rang bzhin ma ni kha dog dkar po gzugs can ma ste /
translated: The nature of the mindfulness of phenomena is the white dakini Rūpiṇī on the northern petal.

original: nang du ni dpral ba'i padma'i de kho na nyid kyi gdan la'o //
analyzed: nang du ni dpral ba'i padma'i de kho na nyid kyi gdan la'o //
translated: Internally, she is on the seat of reality in the lotus of the forehead.

original: bzhi po 'di rnams zhal gcig pa phyag bzhi pa g-yon thod pa dang kha tv'am ga dang / da ma ru dang / gri gug dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di rnams zhal gcig pa phyag bzhi pa g-yon thod pa dang kha tv'am ga dang / da ma ru dang / gri gug dang ldan pa /
translated: All four have one face and four arms, holding a skull cup, khaṭvāṅga, and a ḍamaru and flaying knife in the left hands.

original: g-yas pa'i phyag go //🔽thod pa'i phreng ba'i dbu rgyan can //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i phyag go // thod pa'i phreng ba'i dbu rgyan can //
translated: These four have one face and four arms, holding a skull and khaṭvāṅga in the left hands and a damaru and flaying knife in the right hands.🔽They have head ornaments of strings of skulls.

original: mgo bo'i phreng bas rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: mgo bo'i phreng bas rnam par brgyan //
translated: They are adorned with necklaces of heads.

original: thams cad phyag rgya lngar 'dzin dang // rnam par 'jigs byed drag mo'o //
analyzed: thams cad phyag rgya lngar 'dzin dang // rnam par 'jigs byed drag mo'o //
translated: All of them hold the five symbolic ornaments and are fierce.🔽Then, in the middle of the maṇḍala of wind and fire below the ground, there are the eight great charnel grounds of the unbearable hell, with a spear piercing in the east and so on, a cremation fire, one’s own smell, and putridity.

original: de nas sa 'og tu rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su du ba mi bzad pa dmyal ba chen po dur khrod brgyad de shar la sogs par phyogs la mdung gis 'bigs pa dang / ro bsregs pa dang / rang gi dri dang / rul pa zhes bya ba la rna cha'i rnam ba dang 'dra bar g-yas skor du pho rog dang ;
analyzed: de nas sa 'og tu rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su du ba mi bzad pa dmyal ba chen po dur khrod brgyad de shar la sogs par phyogs la mdung gis 'bigs pa dang / ro bsregs pa dang / rang gi dri dang / rul pa zhes bya ba la rna cha'i rnam ba dang 'dra bar g-yas skor du pho rog dang ;
translated: In the right direction, clockwise, are the faces of a crow,

original: 'ug pa dang / khyi dang / phag pa'i gdong ste /
analyzed: 'ug pa dang / khyi dang / phag pa'i gdong ste /
translated: an owl, a dog, and a pig.

original: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bzhi kha dog dang phyag rgya dang / mtshan ma dang / dbyibs kyi yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / rtsol ba dang dran pa'i rang bzhin du @177a * //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bzhi kha dog dang phyag rgya dang / mtshan ma dang / dbyibs kyi yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / rtsol ba dang dran pa'i rang bzhin du @177a * //
translated: The four dakinis and so on are the nature of color, seal, sign, and shape, the authentic limits of action, livelihood, effort, and mindfulness.🔽

original: bsgom par bya'o //🔽mtshams rnams la rna cha'i rnam pa bzhin /
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o // mtshams rnams la rna cha'i rnam pa bzhin /
translated: One should meditate on the four dakinis and so forth as the nature of color, seal, sign, and shape, the right limits of action, livelihood, effort, and mindfulness.

original: g-yon skor gyis lha mo bzhi ste /🔽dbang ldan gyi byis pa'i rol phyag dang zhal dang / sku mdog dang / dbyibs gzugs can ma bzhin dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyed par byed pa ni gshin rje brtan ma'o /🔽rlung gi sprul gyi mche bas btab pa la dum skyes ma bzhen dge ba skyes pa rnams yang dag par bsrung ba ni gshin rje'i pho nya ma'o //
analyzed: g-yon skor gyis lha mo bzhi ste / dbang ldan gyi byis pa'i rol phyag dang zhal dang / sku mdog dang / dbyibs gzugs can ma bzhin dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyed par byed pa ni gshin rje brtan ma'o / rlung gi sprul gyi mche bas btab pa la dum skyes ma bzhen dge ba skyes pa rnams yang dag par bsrung ba ni gshin rje'i pho nya ma'o //
translated: In the intermediate directions, one should meditate on the four goddesses in the form of earrings,🔽counterclockwise,🔽beginning with Indra.🔽Dhritarastra, in the form of a child, with one face and two arms, with a body color and shape like that of the goddess, is the one who causes the arising of virtuous phenomena that have not yet arisen.🔽Causing the arising of virtuous phenomena that have arisen is Yamadūti, in the form of a pig, with a body color and shape like that of the goddess.

original: bden bral gyi mi bzad pa'i yul du ma bzhin /
analyzed: bden bral gyi mi bzad pa'i yul du ma bzhin /
translated: In the southwest, in the region of the unbearable, is Ghasmarī, in the form of a jackal, with a body color and shape like that of the goddess.

original: gshin rje mche ba ma ni mi dge ba'i chos rnams ma skyes pa rab tu 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: gshin rje mche ba ma ni mi dge ba'i chos rnams ma skyes pa rab tu 'joms par byed do //
translated: The Yāminī-dākinī is the one who utterly destroys the non-arising of non-virtuous dharmas.

original: me'i lhag ma'i dur khrod la mkha' 'gro ma bzhin mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed ba ni gshin rje 'joms ma'o //
analyzed: me'i lhag ma'i dur khrod la mkha' 'gro ma bzhin mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed ba ni gshin rje 'joms ma'o //
translated: The Śmaśānacitā-dākinī is the one who does not produce non-virtuous dharmas that have not arisen.

original: dur khrod kyi lha mo brgyad po 'di rnams ni nang du khva la sogs pa'i sgo brgyad la'o //
analyzed: dur khrod kyi lha mo brgyad po 'di rnams ni nang du khva la sogs pa'i sgo brgyad la'o //
translated: These eight goddesses of the charnel grounds are inside the eight gates of the crows and so forth.

original: mkha' 'gro ma bcu gnyis po 'di rnams stong pa nyid kyi chos can ma ste /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma bcu gnyis po 'di rnams stong pa nyid kyi chos can ma ste /
translated: These twelve ḍākinīs are the dharmatā of emptiness.

original: de bas na dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i gzugs dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das bde mchog la spyan bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: de bas na dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i gzugs dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das bde mchog la spyan bcu gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān Cakrasaṃvara has twelve eyes, endowed with the form of compassion that is without reference point.

original: 'di ni rdo rje phag mo dang lhan cig sbyor ba'o //🔽dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma nyi shu rtsa bzhi la /
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje phag mo dang lhan cig sbyor ba'o // dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma nyi shu rtsa bzhi la /
translated: This is the union with Vajravārāhī.

original: dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang lhan cig tu brjod par byas te /
analyzed: dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang lhan cig tu brjod par byas te /
translated: The twenty-four heroes are to be described in union with the twenty-four Īśvarīs.

original: nam mkha'i ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad kyi thugs kyi 'khor lo'i shar gyi rtsibs kyi gang ba'i rir thod pa'i dum bu can dang rab gtum ma ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad kyi thugs kyi 'khor lo'i shar gyi rtsibs kyi gang ba'i rir thod pa'i dum bu can dang rab gtum ma ste /
translated: On the eastern spoke of the wheel of mind in the eight directions of the sky-mount Meru, on Pūrva-videha Mountain, is Kapālasphati and Prachaṇḍā.

original: nang du ni mgo bo la mi phyed ba zhes bya ba'i rtsa sen mo dang so 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: nang du ni mgo bo la mi phyed ba zhes bya ba'i rtsa sen mo dang so 'bab pa'o //
translated: Internally, on the head is the nāḍī called “indivisible,” where nails and teeth fall.

original: g-yas kyi rtsibs kyi dz'a lan dha rar keng rus chen po dang / gtum mig ma ste /
analyzed: g-yas kyi rtsibs kyi dz'a lan dha rar keng rus chen po dang / gtum mig ma ste /
translated: On the southern spoke, in Jālandhara, is Mahākaṅkāla and Caṇḍākṣī.

original: spyi gtsug tu gzugs phra ma skra dang ba spu 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: spyi gtsug tu gzugs phra ma skra dang ba spu 'bab pa'o //
translated: On the crown of the head is the subtle form where hair and body hair fall.

original: nub phyogs kyi au dya na du keng rus can dang / 'od ldan ma ste /
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi au dya na du keng rus can dang / 'od ldan ma ste /
translated: In the west, in Oḍḍiyāna, is Kaṅkāla and Marīcidāmanī.

original: rna ba g-yas pa'i steng du mdzes ma pags pa dang / dri ma 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba g-yas pa'i steng du mdzes ma pags pa dang / dri ma 'bab pa'o //
translated: Above the right ear is the beautiful skin and dirt.

original: byang gi aarbu dar mche ba gtsigs pa dang / sna chen ma ste ltag par g-yon pa ma sha 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: byang gi aarbu dar mche ba gtsigs pa dang / sna chen ma ste ltag par g-yon pa ma sha 'bab pa'o //
translated: In the north, in Arbuda, is Dānavīra and Mahānāsā, where the left shoulder falls.

original: dpa' po dang dpa' mo 'di rnams kyi longs spyod ni gnas bzhi ste /
analyzed: dpa' po dang dpa' mo 'di rnams kyi longs spyod ni gnas bzhi ste /
translated: The enjoyments of these heroes and heroines are the four places.

original: rna cha'i rnam pa bzhin g-yas skor gyi sngon po dang / dmar po dang / ser po dang / kha dog dkar po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rna cha'i rnam pa bzhin g-yas skor gyi sngon po dang / dmar po dang / ser po dang / kha dog dkar po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The color of the right [ear] is blue, the color of the left is red, the color of the front is yellow, and the color of the back is white.

original: 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang dpyod pa @177b pa dang ; sems kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba'i rang bzhin ma'o zhes ni rab tu dga' ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang dpyod pa @177b pa dang ; sems kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba'i rang bzhin ma'o zhes ni rab tu dga' ba'i sa'o //
translated: They are the nature of the bases of supernatural power of will, effort, analysis, and mind.

original: de dbang ldan gyi rtsibs kyi go d'a wa rir lha'i dgra dang / dbang po'i mgo can ma ste /
analyzed: de dbang ldan gyi rtsibs kyi go d'a wa rir lha'i dgra dang / dbang po'i mgo can ma ste /
translated: In Godāvarī, on the spoke of Indra, is Śakra and the head of Indra.

original: rna ba g-yon pa'i steng du mi'u thung ma rgyus pa 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba g-yon pa'i steng du mi'u thung ma rgyus pa 'bab pa'o //
translated: On the top of the left ear is the dwarf woman, the flow of sinew.

original: rlung mtshams kyi rtsibs kyi r'a me shva rar 'od dpag med dang mi'u thung ma ste /
analyzed: rlung mtshams kyi rtsibs kyi r'a me shva rar 'od dpag med dang mi'u thung ma ste /
translated: In Rāmeśvara, on the spoke of Varuna, is Amitābha and the dwarf woman.

original: smin ma'i dbus su rus sbal las skyes ma rus pa 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: smin ma'i dbus su rus sbal las skyes ma rus pa 'bab pa'o //
translated: In the middle of the eyebrows is the tortoise woman, the flow of bone.

original: bden bral gyi lha mo'i rdzong la /
analyzed: bden bral gyi lha mo'i rdzong la /
translated: In the fortress of the goddess of Nairṛtī,

original: rdo rje 'od dang lang ka'i dbang mo ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'od dang lang ka'i dbang mo ste /
translated: is Vajraprabha and the queen of Laṅkā.

original: mig gnyis la bsgom pa ma mkhal ma 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: mig gnyis la bsgom pa ma mkhal ma 'bab pa'o //
translated: In the two eyes is the meditation woman, the flow of kidney.

original: me'i rtsibs kyi m'a la bar /
analyzed: me'i rtsibs kyi m'a la bar /
translated: In Mālava, on the spoke of Agni,🔽is Amoghasiddhi and the queen of Pūrvavideha.

original: rdo rje lus dang brtson grib ma ste /
analyzed: rdo rje lus dang brtson grib ma ste /
translated: The vajra body, the shadow of exertion,

original: dpung pa'i rtsa bar dbang ma snying 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: dpung pa'i rtsa bar dbang ma snying 'bab pa'o //
translated: and the one who flows to the heart at the base of the arm.

original: zhes ni dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i longs spyod nye ba'i gnas bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhes ni dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i longs spyod nye ba'i gnas bzhi ste /
translated: These are the four abodes of enjoyment of the heroes and heroines.

original: rna cha'i rnam pa bzhin g-yon skor du /
analyzed: rna cha'i rnam pa bzhin g-yon skor du /
translated: Like earrings, they are in the counterclockwise direction.

original: sku ni dkar po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang ljang gu'o //
analyzed: sku ni dkar po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang ljang gu'o //
translated: The body is white, yellow, red, and green.

original: dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin ma ste /
analyzed: dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin ma ste /
translated: They are the nature of faith, exertion, mindfulness, and meditative stabilization.

original: dri ma med pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i sa'o //
translated: They are the stainless stage.

original: de ltar gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang po'i dbang phyug ma'i nye ba'i gnas dang / longs spyod dang ldan pa mkha' spyod ma ste thugs kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang po'i dbang phyug ma'i nye ba'i gnas dang / longs spyod dang ldan pa mkha' spyod ma ste thugs kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: Thus, the abode of the powerful goddess of the senses together with the abode, the enjoyment, and the sky-farer are the mind wheel.

original: de nas sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad kyi shar phyogs kyi rtsibs k'a ma ru par myu gu can dang / sa srungs ma ste /
analyzed: de nas sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad kyi shar phyogs kyi rtsibs k'a ma ru par myu gu can dang / sa srungs ma ste /
translated: Then, on the eight sides of the mandala of Meru in the east, on the spoke of the eastern direction, is Kāmukā and Kṣāntivādinī.

original: mchan khung gnyis la skyon ma dmigs 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: mchan khung gnyis la skyon ma dmigs 'bab pa'o //
translated: They flow to the two armpits.

original: g-yas phyogs kyi au trer ral pa can dang / 'jigs byed chen mo ste nu ma gnyis la mjug ma mkhris pa 'bab pa'o zhes ni dpa' bo dang bcas pa dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma'i longs spyod cing gnyis te 'od byed pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: g-yas phyogs kyi au trer ral pa can dang / 'jigs byed chen mo ste nu ma gnyis la mjug ma mkhris pa 'bab pa'o zhes ni dpa' bo dang bcas pa dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma'i longs spyod cing gnyis te 'od byed pa'i sa'o //
translated: On the right, in Oḍra, is Kapālasphoṭa and Mahābhairavā, who are the enjoyment of the hero and the heroine, respectively, and who are the two breasts, where the milk of the intestines flows.

original: nub phyogs kyi tri sha ku ner dpa' bo chen po dang / rlung shugs ma ste lte par ma mo glo ba 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi tri sha ku ner dpa' bo chen po dang / rlung shugs ma ste lte par ma mo glo ba 'bab pa'o //
translated: On the west, in Triśakuni, is Mahāvira and Mārīcī, who are the enjoyment of the hero and the heroine, respectively, and who are the two kidneys, where the milk of the lungs flows.

original: byang gi ko sa lar rdo rje h'um mdzad dang chang 'thung ma ste /
analyzed: byang gi ko sa lar rdo rje h'um mdzad dang chang 'thung ma ste /
translated: On the north, in Kośala, is Vajrahūṃkāra and Surābhakṣī,🔽who are the enjoyment of the hero and the heroine, respectively, and who are the two nostrils, where the milk of the intestines flows.

original: sna'i rtsi mor mtshan mor rgyu ma'i phreng ba 'bab ma'o zhes dpa' bo dang bcas pa dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma nye ba'i zhing gi longs spyod dang ldan pa ste 'od 'phro ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: sna'i rtsi mor mtshan mor rgyu ma'i phreng ba 'bab ma'o zhes dpa' bo dang bcas pa dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma nye ba'i zhing gi longs spyod dang ldan pa ste 'od 'phro ba'i sa'o //
translated: These are the enjoyment of the hero and the heroine, respectively, and are the two breasts, where the milk of the intestines flows.

original: de ltar zhing dang nye ba'i zhing gi longs spyod dang ldan pa rna cha'i rnam pa bzhin g-yas skor du sku mdog nag po dang / dmar po dang / ser po dang / dkar po'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhing dang nye ba'i zhing gi longs spyod dang ldan pa rna cha'i rnam pa bzhin g-yas skor du sku mdog nag po dang / dmar po dang / ser po dang / dkar po'o //
translated: Thus, endowed with the enjoyment of the field and the subsidiary field, [the goddesses] are like earrings, black, red, yellow, and white, in a clockwise circle.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po @178a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po @178a * //
translated: The faculty of wisdom

original: dang dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa'i stobs kyi rang bzhin ma'o //🔽de nas dbang ldan gyi ka ling kar shin tu bzang mo dang / sdo bsangs lha mo ste /
analyzed: dang dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa'i stobs kyi rang bzhin ma'o // de nas dbang ldan gyi ka ling kar shin tu bzang mo dang / sdo bsangs lha mo ste /
translated: is the nature of the powers of faith, effort, and mindfulness.🔽Then, in Kaliṅga in the northeast, there is Subhadrā and Pāṇḍarādevī.

original: khar sir byin ma glo'i rgyus pa 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: khar sir byin ma glo'i rgyus pa 'bab pa'o //
translated: They are the goddesses of the enjoyment of the caṇḍālī and the pukkasa, who descend to the liver and lungs.

original: rlung phyogs kyi lam p'a kar rdo rje'i 'od dang / shin tu bzang mo ste ;
analyzed: rlung phyogs kyi lam p'a kar rdo rje'i 'od dang / shin tu bzang mo ste ;
translated: In Lampāka in the northwest, there is Vajraprabhā and Subhadrā.

original: mgrin par tsha ba ma gsus pa 'bab pa'o zhes ni dpa' bo dang bcas ba'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma'i tshando ta'i longs spyod dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: mgrin par tsha ba ma gsus pa 'bab pa'o zhes ni dpa' bo dang bcas ba'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma'i tshando ta'i longs spyod dang ldan pa ste /
translated: They are the goddesses of the enjoyment of the caṇḍālī and the pukkasa, who descend to the throat and the stomach.

original: spyang dka' ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: spyang dka' ba'i sa'o //
translated: Thus, endowed with the enjoyment of the caṇḍālī and the pukkasa, [the goddesses] are difficult to conquer.

original: bden bral gyi k'anytsir 'jigs byed chen mo dang / rta rnam ste snying gar gzhol mar dri chen 'bab ma'o //
analyzed: bden bral gyi k'anytsir 'jigs byed chen mo dang / rta rnam ste snying gar gzhol mar dri chen 'bab ma'o //
translated: In the south-east, in Kanya, is Mahabhairava and Hayakarna;🔽in the south-west, in Hemakuta, is Virupaksa and Khakharakarna;

original: me'i mtshams kyi he m'a la yar mig mi bzang dang / khva gdong ma ste /
analyzed: me'i mtshams kyi he m'a la yar mig mi bzang dang / khva gdong ma ste /
translated: in the north-west, in Hemakuta, is Vighnantaka and Mayuraka.

original: chu sor gzugs can ma ther ther 'bab pa'o zhes ni dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dbang phyug ma nye ba'i tshando ha'i longs spyod dang ldan pa ste mngon du gyur pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: chu sor gzugs can ma ther ther 'bab pa'o zhes ni dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dbang phyug ma nye ba'i tshando ha'i longs spyod dang ldan pa ste mngon du gyur pa'i sa'o //
translated: Thus, the hero and the heroines enjoy the upa-chandohas, which are the places of enjoyment, and are the stage of the manifest.

original: tshando ha dang / nye ba'i tshando ha'i longs spyod dang ldan pa rna cha bzhin g-yon skor du sku mdog dkar po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang sngon po'o //
analyzed: tshando ha dang / nye ba'i tshando ha'i longs spyod dang ldan pa rna cha bzhin g-yon skor du sku mdog dkar po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang sngon po'o //
translated: The upa-chandohas and the chandohas are the places of enjoyment, and the heroines are white, yellow, red and blue, like earrings worn on the left.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin dang brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi rang bzhin ma'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin dang brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi rang bzhin ma'o //
translated: They are the nature of the branches of enlightenment, which are meditative concentration, wisdom, and meditative concentration and effort.

original: zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dang / 'dun pa dang nye ba'i 'dun pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa ni sa spyod ma ste gsung gi 'khor lo la'o //
analyzed: zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dang / 'dun pa dang nye ba'i 'dun pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa ni sa spyod ma ste gsung gi 'khor lo la'o //
translated: The enjoyment of the field and the adjacent field, the intention and the adjacent intention, is the earth goddess, in the wheel of speech.

original: des 'og gi rgya mtsho'i dkyil 'khor gyi ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad kyi sku'i 'khor lo'i shar phyogs kyi rtsibs kyi yi dags kyi grong la stobs po che dang 'khor lo'i shugs ma ste /
analyzed: des 'og gi rgya mtsho'i dkyil 'khor gyi ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad kyi sku'i 'khor lo'i shar phyogs kyi rtsibs kyi yi dags kyi grong la stobs po che dang 'khor lo'i shugs ma ste /
translated: In the center of the ocean below, on the eight sides of Mount Meru, on the eastern spoke of the body wheel, in the city of the pretas, is Mahabala and Cakravega.

original: mtshan ma la rang sa ma mchil ma 'bab pa ring du song ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma la rang sa ma mchil ma 'bab pa ring du song ba'i sa'o //
translated: In the sign, the saliva falls on one's own place, the ground of Gone Afar.

original: lho phyogs kyi gri ha de ba tar rin chen rdo rje dang / khanda ro ta ste bshad lam du dpyi ma rang 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi gri ha de ba tar rin chen rdo rje dang / khanda ro ta ste bshad lam du dpyi ma rang 'bab pa'o //
translated: In the south, in Gridhrakuta, is Ratnasa and Khandaroha.

original: nub phyogs kyi soo r'a shtar rta mgrin dang chang 'tshong ma ste /
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi soo r'a shtar rta mgrin dang chang 'tshong ma ste /
translated: In the west, in the city of Sravasti, is Hayagriva and Surata.

original: brla gnyis la rgyu sbyin ma khrag 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: brla gnyis la rgyu sbyin ma khrag 'bab pa'o //
translated: In the two thighs, the blood of Nairatma flows.

original: byang gi gser gyi gling la nam mkha'i snying po dang 'khor lo'i go cha ma ste /
analyzed: byang gi gser gyi gling la nam mkha'i snying po dang 'khor lo'i go cha ma ste /
translated: In the north, in the land of gold, is Akashagarbha and Cakravarmi.

original: byin pa gnyis la sbyor bral ma rdul 'bab ma'o zhes pa ni dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma nye ba'i 'dus pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: byin pa gnyis la sbyor bral ma rdul 'bab ma'o zhes pa ni dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma nye ba'i 'dus pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa ste /
translated: On the two knees are Viśvamātā and Pṛthivī, the “one free from union” and the “one with falling dust,” who are endowed with the enjoyment of the hero and the hero’s lord, respectively.

original: sa mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: sa mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: This is the stage of the immovable.

original: de ltar @178b 'dus pa dang / nye ba'i 'dus pa 'di longs spyod dang ldan pa zlum po'i rnam pa dang 'dra bar g-yon skor du sngon po dang dmar po dang ser bo dang / sku mdog dkar po'o //
analyzed: de ltar @178b 'dus pa dang / nye ba'i 'dus pa 'di longs spyod dang ldan pa zlum po'i rnam pa dang 'dra bar g-yon skor du sngon po dang dmar po dang ser bo dang / sku mdog dkar po'o //
translated: Thus, the assembly and the nearby assembly are endowed with enjoyment and are similar in form to a circle, with blue, red, yellow, and white complexions, respectively.

original: dga' ba shin tu sbyangs pa dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi rang bzhin ma'o //
analyzed: dga' ba shin tu sbyangs pa dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi rang bzhin ma'o //
translated: They are the nature of the factors of awakening that are joy, pliancy, the discrimination of phenomena, and mindfulness.

original: de nas dpal ldan gyi grong khyer du he ru ka dang shin tu dpa' mo ste rkang pa'i sor mo rnams la brtse ba can ma tshil bu 'bab ma'o //
analyzed: de nas dpal ldan gyi grong khyer du he ru ka dang shin tu dpa' mo ste rkang pa'i sor mo rnams la brtse ba can ma tshil bu 'bab ma'o //
translated: Then, in the city of Śrīnagara, there is Heruka and Caṇḍī, who are “the one with affection” and “the one with falling fat,” on the toes.

original: rlung gi sin dhu'i yul du padma gar gyi dbang phyug ma dang / stobs chen ma ste /
analyzed: rlung gi sin dhu'i yul du padma gar gyi dbang phyug ma dang / stobs chen ma ste /
translated: In the land of Sindhu, which is the wind, there is Padmanarteśvara and Mahābalā.

original: rkang pa'i bol dag la grub ma mchi ma 'bab ma'o //🔽zhes ni dpa' bo dang bcas pa dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dur khrod gnyis kyi longs spyod dang ldan pa ste sa legs pa'i blo gros so //
analyzed: rkang pa'i bol dag la grub ma mchi ma 'bab ma'o // zhes ni dpa' bo dang bcas pa dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dur khrod gnyis kyi longs spyod dang ldan pa ste sa legs pa'i blo gros so //
translated: The hero and the heroine, possessing the enjoyments of the two charnel grounds, are in the stage of Good Intelligence.🔽In the charnel ground of the south, in the corpse of the one without compassion, are Vairochana and the Wheel Holder.

original: bden bral gyi ma ror rnam par snang mdzad dang 'khor lo bskor ma ste /🔽rkang pa'i mthe bong dag la 'tshed ma kha spu 'bab ma'o //
analyzed: bden bral gyi ma ror rnam par snang mdzad dang 'khor lo bskor ma ste / rkang pa'i mthe bong dag la 'tshed ma kha spu 'bab ma'o //
translated: The nose of the hero and the heroine, possessing the enjoyments of the two charnel grounds, is in the stage of Good Intelligence.

original: me'i mtshams kyi ku lu t'ar rdo rje sems dpa' dang / brtson chen ma ste /🔽pus mo dag la yid bzangs ma snabs 'bab pa'o zhes ni dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma nye ba'i dur khrod dang ldan pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: me'i mtshams kyi ku lu t'ar rdo rje sems dpa' dang / brtson chen ma ste / pus mo dag la yid bzangs ma snabs 'bab pa'o zhes ni dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma nye ba'i dur khrod dang ldan pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa ste /
translated: In the charnel ground of the southwest, in Kuluta, are Vajrasattva and the Great Effort Woman.🔽The hero and the heroine, possessing the enjoyments of the two charnel grounds, are in the stage of Good Intelligence.🔽In the charnel ground of the west, in the corpse of the one without anger, are Akashagarbha and the Lotus Holder.🔽The hero and the heroine, possessing the enjoyments of the two charnel grounds, are in the stage of Good Intelligence.

original: sa chos kyi sprin no zhes ni dur khrod dang / nye ba'i dur khrod kyi longs spyod dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: sa chos kyi sprin no zhes ni dur khrod dang / nye ba'i dur khrod kyi longs spyod dang ldan pa ni /
translated: In the charnel ground of the northwest, in the corpse of the one without pride, are Amoghasiddhi and the Banner Holder.🔽The hero and the heroine, possessing the enjoyments of the two charnel grounds, are in the stage of Good Intelligence.🔽In the charnel ground of the north, in the corpse of the one without envy, are Ratnasambhava and the Jewel Holder.🔽The hero and the heroine, possessing the enjoyments of the two charnel grounds, are in the stage of Good Intelligence.🔽In the charnel ground of the northeast, in the corpse of the one without ignorance, are Vajradhara and the Lasso Holder.🔽The hero and the heroine, possessing the enjoyments of the two charnel grounds, are in the stage of Good Intelligence.

original: zlum po bzhin g-yon skor du sku mdog dkar po dang / ser po dang dmar po dang sngon po'o /
analyzed: zlum po bzhin g-yon skor du sku mdog dkar po dang / ser po dang dmar po dang sngon po'o /
translated: The colors of the bodies are white, yellow, red, and blue, respectively, in the counterclockwise direction, like a circle.

original: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag ba'i rtsol ba'i rang bzhin ma'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag ba'i rtsol ba'i rang bzhin ma'o //
translated: The nature of the limbs of enlightenment is equanimity, right view, right thought, and right effort.

original: de ltar 'dus pa dang / nye ba'i 'dus pa dang / dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod kyi longs spyod dang ldan pas sa 'og spyod ma'i sku'i 'khor lo la'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dus pa dang / nye ba'i 'dus pa dang / dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod kyi longs spyod dang ldan pas sa 'og spyod ma'i sku'i 'khor lo la'o //
translated: Thus, the wheel of the body of the yoginīs of the lower region is endowed with the enjoyment of the assembly, the nearby assembly, the charnel ground, and the nearby charnel ground.

original: thod pa'i dum bu la sogs pa'i dpa' bo 'di rnams zhal gcig pa phyag bzhi pa ro'i gdan la g-yas brkyang pas bzhugs pa thod pa'i phreng ba dang / dbu rgya na can dbu skra ser skya ni 'jigs par byed pa thams cad phyag rgya lnga 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: thod pa'i dum bu la sogs pa'i dpa' bo 'di rnams zhal gcig pa phyag bzhi pa ro'i gdan la g-yas brkyang pas bzhugs pa thod pa'i phreng ba dang / dbu rgya na can dbu skra ser skya ni 'jigs par byed pa thams cad phyag rgya lnga 'dzin pa'o //
translated: These heroes, Skull-Garland, and so on, have one face, four arms, stand on a corpse seat with the right leg extended, have a garland of skulls and a topknot, have tawny hair, are terrifying, and hold the five symbolic ornaments.

original: sprul gyi tshangs skud dang ldan pa sgeg pa la sogs nyams dang ldan pa mgo bo'i phreng bas rnam par mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: sprul gyi tshangs skud dang ldan pa sgeg pa la sogs nyams dang ldan pa mgo bo'i phreng bas rnam par mdzes pa'o //
translated: He is adorned with a snake's sacred thread, and is endowed with the grace of charm, and so forth, and is beautified with a garland of heads.

original: rab gtum ma la sogs @179a * //
analyzed: rab gtum ma la sogs @179a * //
translated: He embraces the figures of Prachaṇḍā, and so forth,

original: pa'i sku la 'khyud pa rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa thugs kyi 'khor lo la'o //
analyzed: pa'i sku la 'khyud pa rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa thugs kyi 'khor lo la'o //
translated: who hold vajras and vajra bells, on the mind wheel.

original: gsung gi 'khor lo la padma dang padma'i dril bu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gi 'khor lo la padma dang padma'i dril bu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: On the speech wheel, they hold lotuses and lotus bells.

original: sku'i 'khor lo la 'khor lo dang / 'khro lo'i dril bu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i 'khor lo la 'khor lo dang / 'khro lo'i dril bu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: On the body wheel, they hold wheels and wheel bells.

original: thams cad kyi phyag na kha tv'am ga dang thod pa dang da ma ru'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyag na kha tv'am ga dang thod pa dang da ma ru'o //
translated: All of them hold khaṭvāṅgas, skulls, and ḍamarus in their hands.

original: lha mo rnams zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: lha mo rnams zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa /
translated: The goddesses have one face and two arms.

original: gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa /
translated: They hold flaying knives and skulls.

original: drag po'i gzugs can zhal gyi mche ba gtsigs pa rang gi 'od kyi thabs kyi sku la 'khyud pa dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad la 'khor lo'i grangs ji lta bas bdud dang / lha dang lha ma yin dang / mi'i thod pa rnams khrag gis gang ba'o //
analyzed: drag po'i gzugs can zhal gyi mche ba gtsigs pa rang gi 'od kyi thabs kyi sku la 'khyud pa dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad la 'khor lo'i grangs ji lta bas bdud dang / lha dang lha ma yin dang / mi'i thod pa rnams khrag gis gang ba'o //
translated: The heroes and yoginīs are surrounded by as many skull cups as there are wheels, filled with the blood of māras, gods, demigods, and humans.

original: ye shes kyi padma'i shar gyi 'dab ma dang / thugs dang gsung dang / sku dang ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i shar dang me'i dur khrod chen po longs spyod dang ldan pa ni thugs kyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin dang / bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi padma'i shar gyi 'dab ma dang / thugs dang gsung dang / sku dang ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i shar dang me'i dur khrod chen po longs spyod dang ldan pa ni thugs kyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin dang / bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The eastern petal of the lotus of pristine consciousness and the eastern and fire charnel grounds of the mind, speech, body, and pristine consciousness wheels are endowed with enjoyment and are the nature of the mind wheel and the pristine consciousness of successful activities.

original: gsang ba la sogs pa'i las rjes su mthun pa'i dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsang ba la sogs pa'i las rjes su mthun pa'i dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They bestow the corresponding accomplishments of secret and so on.

original: de bzhin du lho phyogs kyi 'dab ma dang lto dang bden bral gyi rtsibs dang lho dang bden bral gyi dur khrod chen po'i longs spyod dang ldan pa ni gsung gi rdo rje'i rang bzhin dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lho phyogs kyi 'dab ma dang lto dang bden bral gyi rtsibs dang lho dang bden bral gyi dur khrod chen po'i longs spyod dang ldan pa ni gsung gi rdo rje'i rang bzhin dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: In the same way, the one endowed with the enjoyment of the southern petal, the southern side, the spoke of Varuna, and the great charnel ground of the south and Varuna is of the nature of Vak-vajra and the nature of the discriminating wisdom.

original: dbang la sogs pa'i lo'i rtsa la bum pa'i sbyor bas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dbang la sogs pa'i lo'i rtsa la bum pa'i sbyor bas gnas pa'o //
translated: It is located in the channel of the year of power and so forth by the application of the vase.

original: de ltar brtan pa dang / nub dang / rlung gi rtsibs dang nub dang rlung gi dur khrod chen po'i longs spyod dang ldan pa ni ye shes kyi zhal rang bzhin dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de ltar brtan pa dang / nub dang / rlung gi rtsibs dang nub dang rlung gi dur khrod chen po'i longs spyod dang ldan pa ni ye shes kyi zhal rang bzhin dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: In the same way, the one endowed with the enjoyment of the western spoke, the western side, the spoke of Marut, and the great charnel ground of the west and Marut is of the nature of the wisdom face and the nature of the wisdom of equality.

original: rengs pa la sogs pa'i las kyi dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rengs pa la sogs pa'i las kyi dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It grants the power of the action of paralysis and so forth.

original: de bzhin du byang gi 'dab ma dang byang dang dbang ldan gyi rtsibs dang / byang dang dbang ldan gyi dur khrod chen po'o longs spyod dang ldan pa'i sku'i zhal gyi rang bzhin dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes kya rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang gi 'dab ma dang byang dang dbang ldan gyi rtsibs dang / byang dang dbang ldan gyi dur khrod chen po'o longs spyod dang ldan pa'i sku'i zhal gyi rang bzhin dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes kya rang bzhin te /
translated: In the same way, the northern petal, the northern and northeastern spokes, and the northern and northeastern great charnel grounds are the nature of the face of the body endowed with enjoyment and the nature of mirror-like primordial wisdom.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi dngos grub kyi 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi dngos grub kyi 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They bestow the fruit of the accomplishments of the activities of pacification and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The Bhagavān is the nature of the utterly pure realm of phenomena.

original: las thams cad kyi dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las thams cad kyi dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He bestows the accomplishments of all activities.

original: rlung dang me dang sa dang chu'i dkyil 'khor ni @179b ji ltar gyur pa'i snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang / lte ba dang dpral ba'i rang rang gi rtsibs kyi steng du rim pa ji lta bas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rlung dang me dang sa dang chu'i dkyil 'khor ni @179b ji ltar gyur pa'i snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang / lte ba dang dpral ba'i rang rang gi rtsibs kyi steng du rim pa ji lta bas shes par bya'o //
translated: The maṇḍalas of wind, fire, earth, and water are to be known in order on the spokes of the heart, throat, navel, and forehead, as they occur.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi kun du spyod pa ni zhal bzhi'i dbye ba yis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi kun du spyod pa ni zhal bzhi'i dbye ba yis so //
translated: The Bhagavān’s conduct is by means of the division of the four faces.

original: phyi rol gyi gdan las 'gro ba'i don du rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i ro'i gdan ji lta ba de de bzhin nang du khams thams cad ni srog gi rlung la'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gdan las 'gro ba'i don du rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i ro'i gdan ji lta ba de de bzhin nang du khams thams cad ni srog gi rlung la'o //
translated: Just as the corpse seats of the Vajra dakini and so forth are for the sake of going out to the external world, in the same way, all the elements are on the life wind internally.

original: rang rang gyi  'khor lo'i rtsibs la ro'i gdan la ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du rang rang gi 'khor lo'i rtsa la bum pa'i sbyor bas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rang rang gyi  'khor lo'i rtsibs la ro'i gdan la ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du rang rang gi 'khor lo'i rtsa la bum pa'i sbyor bas gnas pa'o //
translated: Just as the corpse seats are on the spokes of their respective wheels, in the same way, they are on the channels of their respective wheels by the yoga of the vase.

original: de ltar brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i bdag nyid gcig pu bsgom par byas nas phyag rgya bzhi'i byin gyis rlob par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i bdag nyid gcig pu bsgom par byas nas phyag rgya bzhi'i byin gyis rlob par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having meditated on the nature of all things moving and unmoving as the sole nature of the mandala circle, one should bless the four seals.

original: de la rim pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rim pa 'di yin te /
translated: The stages of that are as follows.

original: mgo bo la yi ge aom las byung ba'i sku'i mkha' 'gro lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba pra ti se na bzhin blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mgo bo la yi ge aom las byung ba'i sku'i mkha' 'gro lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba pra ti se na bzhin blta bar bya'o //
translated: On the head, one should visualize the body dakini arisen from the letter Om, surrounded by a host of goddesses, like a pratisenā.

original: de bzhin du mgrin par a'a: las gsung gi mkha' 'gro / de bzhin du snying gar h'um las thugs kyi mkha' 'gro / de ltar lte ba'i padma'i steng du yi ge tra'i: las byung ba'i ye shes kyi mkha' 'gro ma mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du mgrin par a'a: las gsung gi mkha' 'gro / de bzhin du snying gar h'um las thugs kyi mkha' 'gro / de ltar lte ba'i padma'i steng du yi ge tra'i: las byung ba'i ye shes kyi mkha' 'gro ma mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: Thus, on the lotus of the navel, from the syllable triḥ, is the wisdom ḍākinī, surrounded by a host of mātṛkās.

original: bra ti se na bzhin blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bra ti se na bzhin blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should visualize her like Brahmāṇī.

original: de nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs rnams kyis thugs dang gzung dang sku'i 'khor lo bskul nas rkang ba nas brtsams nas mgo bo'i bar du lus po thams cad 'od gsal bar bsgom bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs rnams kyis thugs dang gzung dang sku'i 'khor lo bskul nas rkang ba nas brtsams nas mgo bo'i bar du lus po thams cad 'od gsal bar bsgom bar bya ste /
translated: Then, the host of light rays that arise from the wisdom wheel arouse the mind, speech, and body wheels. Beginning from the feet up to the head, one should meditate on the whole body as radiant.

original: 'od zer gyis bskul ba'i rim pas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcings pa dang / dbang du gyur par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od zer gyis bskul ba'i rim pas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcings pa dang / dbang du gyur par bya'o //
translated: By the process of being aroused by the light rays, one should summon the wisdom wheel, cause it to enter, bind it, and control it.

original: de nas dpa' bo dang / rnal 'byor ma dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid go char byas te /
analyzed: de nas dpa' bo dang / rnal 'byor ma dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid go char byas te /
translated: Then, one should don the armor of one’s identity endowed with the heroes and yoginīs.

original: ba spu'i bu ga las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi dra ba du ma rgyas pa rnams kyi thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i nam mkha'i khams gang bar byas te /
analyzed: ba spu'i bu ga las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi dra ba du ma rgyas pa rnams kyi thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i nam mkha'i khams gang bar byas te /
translated: The net of light rays that arise from the pores of the body fill the realm of space without end or middle.

original: ye shes kyi 'od zer gyi lcags kyu rnams kyis rigs lngas so sor bcings pa'i mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs bkug nas rang gi sems kyi snang ba'i tshul mdun du bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'od zer gyi lcags kyu rnams kyis rigs lngas so sor bcings pa'i mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs bkug nas rang gi sems kyi snang ba'i tshul mdun du bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Having summoned the hosts of dakas and dakinis bound by the hooks of the light rays of gnosis of the five families, one should meditate on them in the manner of appearances of one’s mind in front.

original: yid kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga yis mchod par @180a * //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga yis mchod par @180a * //
translated: Having made offerings with the five mental objects of desire,

original: byas nas / ye shes kyi bdud rtsis yongs su bkang ba'i padma'i snod kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar rnal 'byor dbang phyug gis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: byas nas / ye shes kyi bdud rtsis yongs su bkang ba'i padma'i snod kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar rnal 'byor dbang phyug gis blta bar bya'o //
translated: one should see the consecration of the wheel of the mandala in the form of the vessel of the lotus filled with the elixir of gnosis by the lord of yogins.

original: de nas mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba'i tshogs de ni rang gi lus la zhugs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba'i tshogs de ni rang gi lus la zhugs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, that host of the net of dakas and dakinis should be meditated on as entering one’s body.

original: slar yang ba spu'i bu ga las mchod pa'i lha mo'i bdag nyid du spros nas /
analyzed: slar yang ba spu'i bu ga las mchod pa'i lha mo'i bdag nyid du spros nas /
translated: Again, having emanated the nature of offering goddesses from the pores of the body hairs,

original: chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam pa'i mchod pa'i sprin gyi tshogs du mas rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam pa'i mchod pa'i sprin gyi tshogs du mas rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la mchod par bya'o //
translated: one should make offerings to the maṇḍala wheel with many clouds of offerings equal with the dharmadhātu.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs dang tshad med pa'i bstod pa rnams kyis bstod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs dang tshad med pa'i bstod pa rnams kyis bstod par bya'o //
translated: One should praise with various praises of immeasurable aspects.

original: de nas sngon du bshad pa'i rim pas rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i ka las skyes pa'i rdzas chen po lnga dang ldan pa'i stobs lnga ni sbyang ba dang / spel ba dang 'bar ba dang / bdud rtsir byas te /
analyzed: de nas sngon du bshad pa'i rim pas rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i ka las skyes pa'i rdzas chen po lnga dang ldan pa'i stobs lnga ni sbyang ba dang / spel ba dang 'bar ba dang / bdud rtsir byas te /
translated: Then, the five strengths endowed with the five great substances generated from the ka on the maṇḍala of wind and fire, as explained previously, are purified, increased, ignited, and made into amṛta.

original: de nyid kyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo tshim par byas nas srid dang mnyam pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin ro gcig la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo tshim par byas nas srid dang mnyam pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin ro gcig la gnas par bya'o //
translated: Having satisfied the maṇḍala wheel with that, one should abide in the single taste of great bliss equal with existence.

original: phyi nas sngags bzlas par brtsam par byas te /
analyzed: phyi nas sngags bzlas par brtsam par byas te /
translated: Afterward, one should begin the recitation of the mantra.

original: srog dang rtsol ba'i rim pas dbang po rnams 'gags par gyur nas /
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba'i rim pas dbang po rnams 'gags par gyur nas /
translated: By the process of prāṇa and āyāma, the senses are arrested.

original: ji srid skyo bar ma gyur gyi bar du ye shes kyi bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid skyo bar ma gyur gyi bar du ye shes kyi bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: One should perform the gnosis repetition as long as one is not weary.

original: dam tshig gi bzlas pa bya ste /
